title: In Italy, Pompeo was handed cheese. The Italian prime minister wasn’t having it.
text:
But Conte appears entirely unamused. “May I ask the lady to step aside, please?” he said.

“I’d be grateful if you could also help,” she appears to say back to him.

AD

“Don’t you worry, I’m doing my job,” Conte replies.

“Take it to Mr. Trump, please, and tell [him] that we make it with our hearts, please,” she calls out to Pompeo, as security agents intervene to escort her offstage.

AD

Martinelli, a journalist with Italy’s satirical “Le Iene” show, later explained to The Washington Post that she was there to deliver a message: Italian dairies are worried about Trump’s looming tariffs on European food products, including wine and cheese, that would cost billions of dollars.

And Italy takes its cheese seriously: Parmigiano-Reggiano is carefully produced under strict regulations at just 330 dairies in Italy.

Parmesan from Wisconsin? How dairy you?! Italy wants to reclaim its cheese.

“My gesture was all about tariffs,” Martinelli said in a phone call with The Post on Tuesday evening.

AD

She packed the cheese in her bag ahead of the photo op Tuesday, she said, along with her black suit — the signature outfit of “Le Iene’s” comedic reporters. She even passed through an X-ray machine on her way into the event, but the cheese didn’t set off any red flags — that is, until she was close to Pompeo, handing it directly to him.

AD

And she seemed to think that on Pompeo’s end, at least, her message was well received.

“He actually seemed very happy about it — he was laughing the whole time,” she said.

As for Conte? He made a bit of a stink.

He grabbed the 30-month-old cheese from Pompeo and handed it off to an aide. “Let me explain, this is the way to prove you’re Italian,” he said, as Pompeo giggled in the background. “Let me do the work of the president of the council. … You, step outside,” he called after Martinelli in Italian.

AD

Then he made a quick recovery as he turned back to Pompeo.

“It’s a good one,” he said, pointing toward the cheese.

“I have no doubt,” Pompeo replied, patting his stomach as the two shared a laugh.

description: The cheese was supposed to symbolize Italian fears about looming Trump tariffs on European food products.
